events.message: I received my new headphones yesterday, but unfortunately the right earbud is making a crackling noise whenever I move. It sounds faulty and disappointing.
Customer reported a potential product defect involving a crackling noise in the right earbud of new headphones.
The case has been assigned to an agent specialized in product quality issues for further assistance.
Hello! I’m sorry to hear about the problem with your headphones. I’m here to help you get this sorted out quickly.
Could you please confirm if the crackling noise occurs all the time or only when moving the earbud? Also, do you see any visible damage or scratches on the product?
The noise happens mostly when I adjust the earbud slightly, and there are no visible scratches or damages on the outside.
Thank you for the details. We can offer you a replacement under the warranty policy as this appears to be a product defect. Would you like us to arrange the shipment?
Yes, I would appreciate that. Please send me the replacement as soon as possible because I rely on these for work.
Great! We have arranged a replacement shipment to your address. You will receive tracking details shortly, and the return for the defective unit is handled automatically.
Just checking in to ensure your replacement headphones arrived and are working properly. Please let us know if you have any further issues.
Since we haven't heard back, we are closing this case. Thank you for your cooperation, and enjoy your new headphones!
Please take a moment to complete our customer satisfaction survey regarding your recent support experience.
